bibl.author: Reuben Farwell
bibl.title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 5 March 1875
bibl.orgName: Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: The articalsarticles you Sent me I received that is the paper a letter & a Picture and your good wishes all arrived at once.

I have not had time to anseranswer yours untilluntil now. I had an auction yestardayyesterday 4 of March to sell my Personallypersonal property As I told you in my other letter I have rented my farm of 35 acersacres for 5 years

I would like to see you very well and it is possiablypossible We may meet again . if I can get an increase of Pension ProbalyProbably I will come and see you. Why can not you comcome & see my family I have a wife & littellittle Girl 5 years old this month When we received your Picture She kissed it and likes to show it to every one that comes in the houseI felt proud of it myselfI will have to get a frame for it and hang it up on the wall

Walt my dear old Friend how I would liklike to grasp your hand and give you a kiss as I did in the days of yore. What a satisfaction it would be to me. We give pasesionpossession the first of April. We move about half a mile from this place my Post office will be the same (address)

postscript.p: I will try and write more next time
Good bybye and God bless you Walt Whitman
